MajorClaims.MC1: education is the single most important factor in the development of a country
MajorClaims.MC2: education plays an important role in the socioeconomic status of a country

Claims.C1: The more people in the country become educated, the better chance it can develop
Claims.C2: these children remain uneducated and will have the same fate as their parents
Claims.C3: the benefits of education can make a man, a society and a developed country

Premises.P1: In a developing country, not many can afford to send their children to school
Premises.P2: There are government schools where tuition fees are practically free but they are not aplenty and mostly are situated in the cities
Premises.P3: They are not reachable by children who live in the mountains or islands
Premises.P4: These children whose parents are either farmers or fishermen, can hardly eat three meals a day, let alone afford to pay for transportation to get to these schools everyday
Premises.P5: Basic education teaches one child to read and write
Premises.P6: Supplementary education provides him with useful knowledge and information
Premises.P7: A further specific education can teach an individual with skills enough to make a living and be self-sufficient
Premises.P8: A well-informed man can act sensibly and make sound judgment
Premises.P9: a skillful man contributes favorably and is valuable to the society
